info.title: API Documentation | Infinity
info.description: Short API Documentation for Infinity application.

post.description: Download the attachment from a given URL, store it, and return an attachment object.

get.description:
Lists all attributes belonging to the board given. The user needs to have access
to the board in order to be able to fetch its attributes.

limit.description: Must be at least 1. Must not be greater than 100.

default_data.description: Default data should be valid value for a given Attribute Type.

settings.description: Depending on the Attribute Type, settings will have different parameters.

get.description:
Get a single attribute by its id for the board given. The user needs to have access to the board
in order to be able to fetch an attribute.

default_data.description: Default data should be valid value for a given Attribute Type.

settings.description: Depending on the Attribute Type, settings will have different parameters.

get.description: Lists all boards that belong to the workspace given.

limit.description: Must be at least 1. Must not be greater than 100.

color.description: Board color in the HEX format.

user_ids.description: Ids of the workspace members that will have board access. Current user will be added automatically

get.description:
Get a single board by its id for the board given. The user needs to have access to the board
in order to be able to fetch it.

Lists the comments of the board and item given.
Comment's property 'created_by' can be included in the response's body by using the 'expand' query parameter.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: expand response with sub-models. Possible options `item`, `item.values`

schema.description: expand response with sub-models. Possible options `item`, `item.values`

limit.description: Must be at least 1. Must not be greater than 100.

text.description: The body of the comment, it can be in the HTML format.

get.description:
Get comment by its id. The comment must belong to the board and item given.
Comment's property 'created_by' can be included in the response's body by using the 'expand' query parameter.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: expand response with sub-models. Possible options `item`, `item.values`

schema.description: expand response with sub-models. Possible options `item`, `item.values`

get.description: Lists all folders that belong to the board given.

limit.description: Must be at least 1. Must not be greater than 100.

color.description: Folder color in the HEX format.

parent_id.description: If folder is sub-folder set parent_id otherwise it will be the top level folder.

attribute_ids.description: An array of attribute IDs that are used in the folder.

settings.description: Meta data for the folder, it can contain many things.

get.description: Get folder by id that belong to the board given.

color.description: Folder color in the HEX format.

attribute_ids.description: An array of attribute IDs that are used in the folder.

delete.description: Deletes a folder by its id.

url.description: The URL that the webhook will call.

get.description: Lists the hooks of the currently logged in user.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: set to 'logs' to include hook logs in the response.

schema.description: set to 'logs' to include hook logs in the response.

url.description: The URL that the webhook will call.

delete.description: Deletes a hook that belongs to the currently logged in user.

get.description: Lists paginated items. Item properties can be expanded.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: expand response with sub-models. Possible options `values`, `values.attribute`, `created_by`, `folder`

schema.description: expand response with sub-models. Possible options `values`, `values.attribute`, `created_by`, `folder`

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Sort items by id or created date - default is created_at

schema.description: Sort items by id or created date - default is created_at

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Sort direction `asc` or `desc` - default is desc.

schema.description: Sort direction `asc` or `desc` - default is desc.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search items by the keyword, it will search by all attribute types giving priority to text value types.

schema.description: Search items by the keyword, it will search by all attribute types giving priority to text value types.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Use this parameter to get items after last item. Use this to get to the next page.

schema.description: Use this parameter to get items after last item. Use this to get to the next page.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Use this parameter to get items before first item.

schema.description: Use this parameter to get items before first item.

limit.description: Must be at least 1. Must not be greater than 100.

get.description: Get item by its id. The item must belong to the board given. Item properties can be expanded.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: expand response with sub-models. Possible options `values`, `values.attribute`, `created_by`, `folder`

schema.description: expand response with sub-models. Possible options `values`, `values.attribute`, `created_by`, `folder`

values.data: The Park Gell is a public park system composed of gardens and architectonic elements located on Carmel Hill, in Barcelona, Catalonia, Spain. Carmel Hill belongs to the mountain range of Collserola  the Parc del Carmel is located on the northern face.

example.data: The Park Gell is a public park system composed of gardens and architectonic elements located on Carmel Hill, in Barcelona, Catalonia, Spain. Carmel Hill belongs to the mountain range of Collserola  the Parc del Carmel is located on the northern face.

get.description: The response contains all the data related to the current user, including some fields that are not visible to other users.

parameters.name: from_item_id
parameters.description: Filter items by source item id

schema.description: Filter items by source item id

parameters.name: to_item_id
parameters.description: Filter items by source item id

schema.description: Filter items by source item id

parameters.name: attribute_id
parameters.description: Filter items by source item id

schema.description: Filter items by source item id

limit.description: Must be at least 1. Must not be greater than 100.

post.description: Creates a reference between two items.

get.description: Get reference by its id for the given board.

delete.description: Delete a reference between two items.

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: Optional parameter. The id of the folder view.

get.description: Lists all users that belong to the current workspace given.

limit.description: Must be at least 1. Must not be greater than 100.

get.description: List all folder views for the board given.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: Get views only from selected folder

schema.description: Get views only from selected folder

limit.description: Must be at least 1. Must not be greater than 100.

post.description: Creates a folder view in the board given.

type.description: Supported types: `list`, `column`, `table`, `calendar`, `gantt` and `form`. Each of these types has its own set of rules that should be put in the settings.

get.description: Get folder view by its id for the board given.

put.description: Updates a folder view in the board given.

type.description: Supported types: `list`, `column`, `table`, `calendar`, `gantt` and `form`. Each of these types has its own set of rules that should be put in the settings.

delete.description: Deletes folder view by its id

get.description: Lists all workspaces that belong to the currently logged in user.

limit.description: Must be at least 1. Must not be greater than 100.

tags.name: Hooks
Views
tags.description: Folder views (tabs) is a configuration of how data will be presented in a given folder. It can contain view type (e.g. column or table), filters (what items to show) and many other settings that can be specific for the view (for example last viewed date in the calendar view).
